title: ‘Bye Bridget’: Somerville bakery claps back at internet ‘troll’ with a line of merch
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Somerville's Hearth & Hug Bakery responded to online criticism by launching 'Bye Bridget' merchandise to support charitable donations.
The bakery was criticized for donating 10% of sales to a Minnesota food bank instead of closing during anti-ICE protests.
Proceeds from 'Bye Bridget' merch will be donated to charity, continuing the bakery's tradition of supporting various causes.

title: ‘Keep their light on in our world’: Daughter remembers Eastham couple who fell through ice
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jerry and Kit Boucher fell through ice at Bee’s River in Eastham, resulting in their deaths on February 14.
Daughter Katy Boucher paid tribute to her parents and encouraged acts of kindness in their memory.
Visiting hours are scheduled at St. Joan of Arc Church in Orleans on February 27-28, with a memorial mass to follow.

title: 3 fires being investigated as arson in Fitchburg, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Three fires in Fitchburg are being investigated as arson, with incidents occurring within days of each other.
Fires occurred in a large apartment building and a multi-family home, displacing seven and injuring one.
Authorities do not believe the Myrtle Avenue fire is connected to the Blossom and Day streets apartment fires.

title: Eric Dane, ‘Grey’s Anatomy’ star and ALS awareness advocate, dies at 53
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Eric Dane, actor known for 'Grey's Anatomy' and 'Euphoria,' died at 53 from ALS, announced less than a year ago.
Dane became an advocate for ALS awareness, awarded ALS Network's advocate of the year in 2025.
He is survived by wife Rebecca Gayheart and daughters Billie and Georgia; memoir to be published in late 2026.

title: 4 Mass. State Police troopers charged in death of recruit suspended with pay
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Four Massachusetts State Police troopers charged with manslaughter in Enrique Delgado-Garcia's death are suspended with pay.
The troopers, involved in an incident during a defensive tactics exercise, faced duty status hearings following the charges.
An independent investigation led to the discovery of their roles, prompting changes in State Police Academy leadership and practices.

title: Braintree police warn public about planned ‘takeover’ at South Shore Plaza
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Braintree police are preparing for a planned 'takeover' event at the South Shore Plaza on Friday evening.
The event was advertised on social media, prompting police to issue a public safety alert and coordinate with other agencies.
Past events similar to the planned takeover involved blocking streets for car activities, leading to police interventions and safety concerns.

title: Kendrick Perkins has Celtics as ‘dark horse’ to win title in 2026 — under 1 condition
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kendrick Perkins believes the Celtics could win the NBA title in 2026 if Jayson Tatum returns from injury.
Boston Celtics are performing well without Tatum, with a 35-19 record, and rank second in the Eastern Conference.
Jaylen Brown's performance positions him as a likely MVP contender, enhancing the Celtics' postseason prospects.

title: What would it take for the Patriots to land AJ Brown? ESPN analyst cooked up a hypothetical trade.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: ESPN analyst proposes Patriots trade a 2026 first, third, and sixth-round pick for Eagles' AJ Brown and a 2026 second-round pick.
AJ Brown, 28, is coming off his fourth 1,000-yard season and is seen as an upgrade for the Patriots' receiver group.
Brown is signed through 2029 with a $96 million extension and maintained top 10 performance in ESPN's receiver metrics.

title: Why Kyle Pitts could be the Patriots’ top free-agent target
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kyle Pitts caught 88 passes for 928 yards and five touchdowns with Atlanta in 2025.
Patriots' offense needs upgrades after a Super Bowl loss to Seattle, especially at pass-catching positions.
Pitts, a potential free agent, could sign with the Patriots for a projected four-year, $70 million contract.

title: Provincetown man pleads guilty to possessing, distributing thousands of child porn files
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Laurence Pagnoni, 65, of Provincetown, pleaded guilty to possession and distribution of child pornography in federal court.
Authorities received a tip-off leading to Pagnoni's arrest in April 2024 for distributing child pornography via MEGA.
Investigators recovered thousands of child pornographic files from Pagnoni's cell phone during a home search in May 2023.
